meanings.definition: A person who signs a document.
meanings.sent1: The signors on the contract were happy to finalize the deal.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer collected the signatures of all the signors on the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The signors at the meeting had to use a giant pen to sign the huge document.
meanings.sent4: The signors were like stars in the sky, each one adding their unique mark.
meanings.sent5: The signors were like the heroes of the story, sealing their fate with each signature.

meanings.sent1: The signors gathered at the event looked elegant and distinguished.
meanings.sent2: I greeted the signors with a warm smile as they entered the room.
meanings.sent3: The signors decided to wear matching hats for a fun group photo.
meanings.sent4: The signors stood out in the crowd like a bouquet of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The signors were like a team of champions, united in purpose and style.
